urls.title: Bangor Scientists embarrass Glastonbury Festival with ‚Äúsneaky‚Äù research - Wolf Reporter
urls.description: The scientist behind a recent study which detected harmful drug metabolite levels in water near the Glastonbury Festival site has revealed festival organisers had no idea the research was going ahead. Dan Aberg, MSc student at Bangor University, found cocaine and MDMA metabolites in waste water near the Glastonbury festival site. This was found at levels which are known to be harmful to endangered European Eels. Dan said the organisers only found out about the work afterwards and described it as ‚Äòa bit sneaky‚Äô. However, Mr Aberg said Glastonbury is one of the most ‚Äúenvironmentally aware‚Äù festivals.¬† ‚ÄúA lot of blame has been shoved towards Glastonbury‚Ä¶ but I think it‚Äôs important to remember that it‚Äôs not on Glastonbury to get people to use the toilets. I think people need to‚Ä¶ take responsibility for their actions.‚Äù Dan hopes to work with Glastonbury to impress upon festival-goers the need to use the toilets.¬† He was inspired to do the research after reading about a similar project abroa

urls.title: Case closed?
urls.description: Dover Council Planning Department could simply order another ecological survey of the sight adjacent to Stanhope Road, to take place next summer.¬† Instead, the case has been referred to Planning Enforcement.¬† Since the Senior Planning Officer has pre-judged the outcome, writing that "ecological matters have been fully considered", I am anything but confident. Will ranks close? Will there be more weasle words as wiggly as a slow worm?¬† I rather think so. Thank you to everybody who has signed and shared, and especially to those compassionate souls who felt able to promote this petition, even in these times.¬† My aim is 40,000 signatures and we are nearly there.¬† Please let's keep going, to send a ROAR of protest to Dover Council and councils everywhere: "Don't tolerate sharp practice in developers and landowners! Listen to the residents! Protect your wildlife!`'
